page.title: 05Grantham:St. Vincents
page.content: The South Kesteven District Coucil has two major administrative buildings. Several offices are in the centre of the town at the Guildhall.The Chief Executive, the Secretary,and the District Planning Officer have their offices in the building known as St Vincents. This was built as a private residence in Victorian gothic style towards the end of the last century. During the Second World War the building housed the local Headquarters of Bomber Command.Many major raids on Germany were planned here including the Dambusters raid. As a result of this association with the Royal Air Force a small museum devoted to air warfare has recently been set up at St Vincents.As St Vincents now houses the Superintendant of Marriages,civil weddings now take place there.
